title: Peacock Schedule March 17-23 2025: New TV Shows & Movies Being Added
description: Peacock‘s new TV and movie releases for March 17-23, 2025, include Wicked and the first season finale of Happy’s Place. March 21 brings Wicked and its feature-length sing-along alternate version to Peacock. This film was directed by Jon M. Chu, whose previous credits include Now You See Me 2, In the Heights, and Crazy Rich […] The post Peacock Schedule March 17-23 2025: New TV Shows & Movies Being Added appeared first on ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More.
author: Abdul Azim Naushad
excerpt: Fans curious about Peacock's schedule for March 17-23, 2025, can find out about the movies and TV shows releasing in this story.
siteName: ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More
text: Peacock‘s new TV and movie releases for March 17-23, 2025, include Wicked and the first season finale of Happy’s Place. March 21 brings Wicked and its feature-length sing-along alternate version to Peacock. This film was directed by Jon M. Chu, whose previous credits include Now You See Me 2, In the Heights, and Crazy Rich Asians. Featuring Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande, the movie is set in the fictional land of Oz. It follows Elphaba, an ostracized green-skinned woman who befriends her roommate, the popular and beautiful Glinda at Shiz University. However, the pair’s friendship is challenged by their diverging paths as the Wicked Witch of the West and Glinda the Good. Then, March 22 brings Happy’s Place Season 1 finale to Peacock. This comedy drama featuring Reba McEntire follows Bobbie, a woman who gets her father’s eatery after his demise. Bobbie eventually learns that her business partner is none other than her estranged half-sister, much to her dismay. Also releasing on Peacock this week are the films The Invisible Man and Minions: The Rise of Gru. The Invisible Man follows Cecilia, whose life dramatically changes when her abusive ex-partner suddenly dies by suicide. He leaves her his fortune. Suspecting a hoax, and after several near brushes with death, Cecilia tries to prove to her friends that an invisible being is hunting her down. Minions: The Rise of Gru, a prequel to the Despicable Me films, follows a young Gru who, with the help of the Minions, tries to become evil enough to join his favorite supervillain team, the Vicious 6. New Peacock releases for March 17-23 2025 Peacock is adding the following television shows and movies between March 17-23, 2025. March 19 The Invisible Man (2020) Opry 100: A Live Celebration March 20 Rescued Chimpanzees of the Congo With Jane Goodall March 21 Filth Hammer of the Gods The Right Kind of Wrong Wicked – Premiere (Peacock Exclusive) Wicked – Sing-Along Alternate Feature-Length Version – Premiere (Peacock Exclusive) March 22 Happy’s Place, Season 1 – Finale (NBC) March 23 Hearts Around the Table: Jenna’s First Love  Minions: The Rise of Gru  For more Peacock content, check out the teaser trailer and learn the release date of Poker Face Season 2. Also, an The Office alum is returning for its sequel series, The Paper.
html:
Peacock‘s new TV and movie releases for March 17-23, 2025, include Wicked and the first season finale of Happy’s Place.

March 21 brings Wicked and its feature-length sing-along alternate version to Peacock. This film was directed by Jon M. Chu, whose previous credits include Now You See Me 2, In the Heights, and Crazy Rich Asians. Featuring Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande, the movie is set in the fictional land of Oz. It follows Elphaba, an ostracized green-skinned woman who befriends her roommate, the popular and beautiful Glinda at Shiz University. However, the pair’s friendship is challenged by their diverging paths as the Wicked Witch of the West and Glinda the Good.

Then, March 22 brings Happy’s Place Season 1 finale to Peacock. This comedy drama featuring Reba McEntire follows Bobbie, a woman who gets her father’s eatery after his demise. Bobbie eventually learns that her business partner is none other than her estranged half-sister, much to her dismay.

Also releasing on Peacock this week are the films The Invisible Man and Minions: The Rise of Gru.

The Invisible Man follows Cecilia, whose life dramatically changes when her abusive ex-partner suddenly dies by suicide. He leaves her his fortune. Suspecting a hoax, and after several near brushes with death, Cecilia tries to prove to her friends that an invisible being is hunting her down.

Minions: The Rise of Gru, a prequel to the Despicable Me films, follows a young Gru who, with the help of the Minions, tries to become evil enough to join his favorite supervillain team, the Vicious 6.

New Peacock releases for March 17-23 2025

Peacock is adding the following television shows and movies between March 17-23, 2025.

March 19

  • The Invisible Man (2020)
  • Opry 100: A Live Celebration

March 20

  • Rescued Chimpanzees of the Congo With Jane Goodall

March 21

  • Filth
  • Hammer of the Gods
  • The Right Kind of Wrong
  • Wicked – Premiere (Peacock Exclusive)
  • Wicked – Sing-Along Alternate Feature-Length Version – Premiere (Peacock Exclusive)

March 22

  • Happy’s Place, Season 1 – Finale (NBC)

March 23

  • Hearts Around the Table: Jenna’s First Love 
  • Minions: The Rise of Gru 

For more Peacock content, check out the teaser trailer and learn the release date of Poker Face Season 2. Also, an The Office alum is returning for its sequel series, The Paper.
